column1: In the aftermath of the bloody Battle of Azanulbizar the surviving Dwarves were unable to properly dispose of their dead
column2: having neither the time nor the resources to build stone tombs and refusing to bury their fallen comrades in earth
column3: this being against their traditions.  Therefore they had no choice but to burn the corpses.  Any Dwarf whose relative was killed in the battle would proudly say he was a Burned Dwarf
column4: thus declaring that his or her ancestor fought and fell in that terrible conflict. Balin and Dwalin father Fundin
column5: Thorin Oakenshield younger brother Frerin and Dain Ironfoot father Náin (son of Grór) were all among the Burned Dwarves of Azanulbizar.
